cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.MM. 

The paper deals with human motion prediction from motion capture data, which is a classic problem in computer vision. The proposed method involves learning local structure representations and temporal dependencies, which are key areas of research in computer vision and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves the use of neural networks, which is a common technique in machine learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also involves the use of artificial intelligence techniques, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category. The paper also involves the use of robotics, making cs.RO (Robotics) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of motion capture data, making cs.MM (Multimedia) a possible sub-category.
